channel.title: Game suggestions
channel.description: My dad wants a game like Skyrim, any suggestions?

item.title: Game suggestions
item.dc:creator: Serza
item.description:
Extreme issue, heh. Played Dead Island through with Xian Mei, the sharp weapon specialist, and cut off limbs is one of the most common things, along with SHOWERS of blood. Sometimes I thought they overdid the gore thing a bit. I’ll check for you if you can turn it off though.

Read full topic

item.title: Game suggestions
item.dc:creator: GilCMassey
item.description:
Dead Islands a fantastic game. But…if I remember correctly, gore is an issue.

Read full topic

item.title: Game suggestions
item.dc:creator: Serza
item.description:
SHIFT and overloading/incinerating/cryo blasting/energy draining whoever is close enough to harm you is often a better thing to do

Also, I’m not sure about this, but (at least in Czech version, ME2 came with it and I didn’t find a way to change it) Tali’s Energy Drain suggests YOUR shields get a recharge - nope. It’s the users, thus Tali’s, but you Energy Drain is available as a bonus power.

And Tech is so much boss. Overload damages Barriers as much as Shields, Incinerate screws over whatever isn’t shielded… And then you can always cloak, if you’re an infiltrator.

Read full topic

item.title: Game suggestions
item.dc:creator: Dalek
item.description:
I picked up Me2 for him and told him to mash space bar when it gets bad

Read full topic

item.title: Game suggestions
item.dc:creator: Grach
item.description:
Serza:

[…]You’re KILLING PEOPLE and don’t want INSULTS? Get your bloody priorities right! When I’m trying to SHOOT the other guy, it’s WAY past mere insults!

That is curiously similar to the attitude of Mothers Against Canada in the South Park movie.

OT: Oblivion then? Fallout?

[COLOR=‘Black’]

… Mary Kate & Ashley?[/SIZE]

Read full topic

item.title: Game suggestions
item.dc:creator: k3nny1550
item.description:
If swearing is a problem, then we definitely shouldn’t suggest F.E.A.R…

Read full topic

item.title: Game suggestions
item.dc:creator: GilCMassey
item.description:
Yeah, swearing is kinda minimal throughout the game series except from jack and a couple other parts. But even then it’s word like hell, bullshit, damn, and that’s about it really. Except jack.

Read full topic

item.title: Game suggestions
item.dc:creator: Serza
item.description:
Dalek:

Are there clean language patches for those? My mom won’t tolerate any games with high levels of foul language

You’re talking about removing good half of the character of Jack.

Tali’s “bosh’tet” is the cutest sounding insult I’ve ever heard…

And when Garrus says “Oh crap”, the word is a bloody masterpiece.

Plus… You’re KILLING PEOPLE and don’t want INSULTS? Get your bloody priorities right! When I’m trying to SHOOT the other guy, it’s WAY past mere insults!

But other than Jack, everyone’s mostly polite. So if he stays away from Jack in the second game (except for her recruitment, she’s mandatory due to being a Specialist for the suicide mission - I’m kinda sure that you only need four people to not loose anybody during the mission, if you do it VERY clever… But you can have Samara do the job during the SM anyway.) And even Jack is polite-ish in the third game. “Maintain profesionality”… Plus even if she doesn’t die in the second, just stay away from Grissom Academy and you’re not meeting her again.

Read full topic

I’ll suggest it then

item.title: Game suggestions
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
It has some instances of heavy swearing but they’re not very common. ME1 has none at all afaik. I think it’s fairly safe to play for the most part.

Honestly tell your mom to man the fuck up and deal with it.

item.title: Game suggestions
item.dc:creator: Dalek
item.description:
Maxey:

What’s his favorite aspect from Skyrim? The open world exploration? The rpg mechanics? The talking to different characters and having to make decisions?

The open-world aspect and the storyline starting right away.

item.title: Game suggestions
item.dc:creator: Pyroclase
item.description:
There’s also Morrowind and Oblivion, but it’s generally frustrating to go back to an earlier game with less refined mechanics, so I wouldn’t recommend it.
